content:
• Tuesday, June 19, 2018
  • IBP

    IBP increases size, maturity of credit facilities

    • Installed Building Products (NYSE:IBP) has boosted the size of its Term Loan B facility and its ABL revolving credit facility, and extended each maturity by about a year.
    • The Term Loan B (at $397.8M) now matures April 15, 2025, with pricing remaining at Libor plus 250 basis points (Libor floor of 1%). RBC, Jefferies and SunTrust were joint lead arrangers and joint book-runners.
    • The company's $150M revolver matures now on June 19, 2023. SunTrust was ABL agent and RBC Term Loan agent.
    • Shares are 1.5% lower after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 PM
  • CVG

    Convergys +4.3% on report of potential sale to Synnex

    • Call center operator Convergys (NYSE:CVG) is up 4.3% after hours on a Reuters report that Synnex (NYSE:SNX) is in talks to buy it out.
    • Synnex, a business process services company, has a market cap of $4.55B; Synnex is worth about $2.33B.
    • Convergys had previously spun off from Cincinnati Bell and became a separate public company in 1998. Its stock has moved earlier this year amid talk of a potential sale after its CEO's exit.
    • Synnex is up 1.2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • EGY

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/19/2018)

    • Top gainers: EGY +5.1%. ARNC +1.4%. BRFS +1.3%. HAS +1.2%. YNDX +0.95%.
    • Top Losers: LZB -6.7%. GDS -3.2%.  GOL -2.3%. JOBS -1.9%. JCP -1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • PRTA

    Prothena up 1% after publishing positive Parkinson's treatment data

    • Results from the Phase 1b study of PRX002/RG7935 showed acceptable safety and tolerability in patients with Parkinson's disease, thus meeting the trial's primary endpoint.
    • The results support advancing to the PASADENA Phase 2 study, which is currently ongoing.
    • The results were previously presented at a conference in April. They've now been published in JAMA Neurology.
    • Source: Press Release
    • PRTA +1.1% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • MLNX

    Mellanox reaches board member agreement with Starboard

    • Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) announces reaching an agreement with activist investor Starboard.
    • Starboard-recommended directors Jon Olson and Greg Waters will join the Mellanox board along with Jack Lazar, an independent director mutually chosen by Mellanox and Starboard. Appointments are effective immediately.
    • Prior board members Dov Baharav, Shai Cohen, and Tom Riordan stepped down to make room for the new members.
    • Audit committee chair Thom Weatherford will stay on until March 2, 2019, and then step down.
    • Starboard has the right to appoint a direct representative to the board if Mellanox doesn’t meet certain operating performance thresholds for FY18 or certain last twelve months periods during FY19.  
    • Mellanox shares are down 0.6% aftermarket to $83.80. 
    • Previously: Reuters: Mellanox close to board member deal with Starboard (June 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • PTCT

    Sell-siders defend PTC Therapeutics after Sarepta-stoked 31% plunge

    • On cue, bullish sell-side analysts rush to defend PTC Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PTCT), down 31% on more than a 10x surge in volume today in apparent response to encouraging preliminary data on Sarepta Therapeutics' gene therapy candidate for Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD).
    • William Blair's Raju Prasad (Outperform): Acknowledges that Sarepta's data are "impressive," but cites the company's announced goal of a 15% CAGR for Translarna as one reason for longs to stay the course.
    • RBC's Brian Abrahams (Outperform/$45): Does not see "major read-through" from SRPT's gene therapy and does not expect its potential future success to "necessarily dramatically impact" PTC's long-term sales opportunity.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • ORCL

    Oracle reports Q4 beats with 8% Cloud Services growth

    • Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) gains 0.8% aftermarket on Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 3% Y/Y revenue growth. Guidance will come on the earnings call.
    • Revenue breakdown: Cloud Services and License Support, $6.77B (+8% Y/Y); Cloud and On-Premise Software,  $2.5B (-5%); Hardware, $1.12B (flat); Services, $883M (-1%). 
    • Key metrics: Total operating expenses, $6.87B (+1%); cash and equivalents, $21.62B; total liabilities (current and non-current), $91B. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Oracle beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (June 19)
    • Previously: Oracle declares $0.19 dividend (June 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 3 Comments
  • FDX

    FedEx slightly higher after earnings

    • FedEx (NYSE:FDX) pokes higher in AH trading after beating FQ4 estimates and updating guidance for the next fiscal year.
    • Operating income came in at $2.0B in FQ4 vs. $1.74B a year ago. Operating margin was up 40 bps to 11.5% of sales., which was on the top end of the company's guidance range. Operating margin in the ground segment was 17.3% of sales.
    • Looking ahead, the company sees FY19 EPS of $17.00 to $17.60 vs $17.47 consensus off revenue growth of 9%.
    • Previously: FedEx beats by $0.23, beats on revenue (June 19)
    • FDX +0.72% AH to $260.24 after dropping 2.0% during the regular trading session.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 3 Comments
  • KALA

    Kala Pharma to conduct new late-stage study for dry eye disease candidate KPI-121; shares up 1% after hours

    • Thinly traded micro cap Kala Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KALA) perks up 1% after hours following its announced development update for lead candidate KPI-121 0.25% in dry eye disease.
    • Despite uneven results from two earlier Phase 3 studies, it plans to submit its U.S. marketing application in H2. It also plans to launch another Phase 3 study, STRIDE 3, next quarter that it says should resolve the mixed results from STRIDE 1 & 2. Topline data should be available in Q4 2019.
    • Concurrently, it is preparing for the potential FDA approval and market launch of KPI-121 1%, branded as INVELTYS, for the twice-daily treatment of postoperative ocular inflammation and pain. The agency's action date is August 24.
    • Previously: Kala Pharma's lead candidate shows mixed results in two late-state dry eye disease studies; shares down 16% premarket (Jan. 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • WIN

    S&P downgrades Windstream credit on exchange offer

    • Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) finished the regular session up 2%, but S&P has now downgraded the company's rating to CC from B-, with a negative outlook.
    • It's basing that on the stance that Windstream's recent exchange offer is a distressed transaction, with investors getting less than face value.
    • The negative outlook suggests that a completed exchange would have S&P reducing the corporate credit rating to SD and ratings on affected issues to D.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 31 Comments
  • KIN

    Kindred Bio initiates stock offering; shares off 3% after hours

    • Kindred Biosciences (NASDAQ:KIN) is down 3% after hours in response to its announced public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be released.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • APEN

    Apollo Endosurgery launches stock offering; shares down 34% after hours

    • Apollo Endosurgery (NASDAQ:APEN) slumps 34% after hours in response to its announced public offering of common stock. Price, volume and terms have yet to be released.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Oracle (NYSE:ORCL): Q4 EPS of $0.99 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $11.25B (+2.8% Y/Y) beats by $60M.
    • Shares +1.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 10 Comments
  • BA

    Dow underperforms as trade war whacks CAT, Boeing

    • The S&P 500 and Nasdaq are down just a modest 0.5%, but the DJIA (NYSEARCA:DIA) is lower by 1.3% after amped up trade war chatter between China and the U.S. Worst performers on a percentage basis are Boeing (BA -4%) and Caterpillar (CAT -3.9%), followed by DowDuPont (DWDP -2.3%) and 3M (MMM -2.6%).
    • In the green are more defensive plays like Verizon, J&J, and Procter & Gamble.
    • Previously: Trade war: China leads world markets lower (June 19)
    • ETFs: DIA, UDOW, DOG, DXD, SDOW, DDM, EDOW, UDPIX
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 29 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia, Orange conduct successful RAN trial for 5G

    • Another micro-move in 5G development sees Nokia (NOK -1.7%) conducting its first cloud radio access network trial using Orange's (ORAN -0.1%) cloud infrastructure platform.
    • The test, in Poland, is preparation for Orange's future distributed cloud architecture for 5G.
    • "The quality and performance observed during the trial give confidence on the RAN virtualization and is a critical step for us towards 5G," says Orange Poland's Piotr Jaworski.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • XEC

    Cimarex Energy continues nearly 10% two-day surge

    • Cimarex Energy (XEC +3.5%) surges for a second straight day after Cowen analyst Charles Robertson reiterates an Outperform rating on the shares and raises his stock price target to $130 from $115.
    • Robertson thinks investor fears about the H2 ramp at XEC are overdone since the company has the firm capacity to achieve its 2018-19 production growth while also maintaining a strong balance sheet.
    • XEC jumped 5.7% in yesterday's trade, the biggest gainer among a wave of rising energy shares; shares have soared ~9.5% in two days.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM | 3 Comments
  • LFIN

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/19/2018)

    • Gainers: OTCPK:LFIN +16%. OCC +13%. COTV +10%. LFGR +6%. AMRH +6%.
    • Losers: SYX -11%. SMAR -10%. CBLK -9%. SOGO -8%. ABIL -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • TNTR-OLD

    Tintri -22.2% on continued volatility, high volume

    • Tintri (NASDAQ:TNTR-OLD) remains volatile after announcing last week that it might lack the liquidity to continue beyond June 30.
    • Current volume is 3.3M compared to the 1.52M average.
    • Tintri shares are down 52.7% in the past week, 77% in the past month, and 95.1% YTD.
    • Tintri shares are down 22.2% to $0.20.
    • Previously: Tintri lacks liquidity to continue beyond June 30; TNTR -39.5% (June 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 7 Comments
  • AMD

    AMD, Alibaba dip on high volume

    • Information Technology stocks moving on high volume include AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) and Alibaba (NYSE:BABA).
    • AMD shares are down 2.6% with volume at about 74.35M compared to the 58.35M average. 
    • Alibaba shares are down 2.2% with volume at around 19.34M compared to the 17.44M average.       
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 70 Comments
  • NDLS

    Noodles breaks to new high

    • Noodles (NDLS +7.5%) trades higher after management presented today at the Jefferies 2018 Consumer Conference.
    • Shares of the restaurant operator carved out a new 52-week high of $11.55 earlier.
    • Short interest on Noodles represents more than 10% of outstanding shares.
    • Noodles investor presentation webcast
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 18 Comments
  • RENN

    More on Renren 's Q1 results

    • Renren (RENN) reported Q1 revenue growth of 570% Y/Y to $140.6M due to the launch of the used car retail business in the 2Q17.
    • Segment revenues: Internet value added services $14.7M (+26.5% Y/Y), Financing income $2.2M (-76.4% Y/Y) and Used cars sales $123.6M.
    • Q1 Overall margins: Gross declined by 2,229 bps to 8.5% and operating recovered by 6,585 bps to -18.2%
    • Q1 Expenses: Selling & marketing $11.9M (+92.9% Y/Y), R&D $7.3M (+26.9% Y/Y) and G&A $18.2M (+50.6% Y/Y).
    • The Transaction announced on April 30, 2018 was intended to address concerns that Renren may be deemed to be an investment company within the meaning of the Investment Company Act and is expected to close on June 21, 2018. The Transaction will have a significant impact on the Company's financial statements.
    • 2Q18 Outlook: Revenue $140-145M (+527%-549% Y/Y).
    • Previously: Renren reports Q1 results (June 19)
    • Previously: Renren announces dividend, private placement; shares -4.7% (April 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 6 Comments
  • GOOG

    NYT's social media relations: Google's good, Facebook's failing

    • Speaking in Cannes, New York Times (NYT -0.2%) CEO Mark Thompson has given a review of his company's news relationship with social media platforms -- and from his perspective, Facebook's (FB -0.6%) declining while Google (GOOG -0.9%, GOOGL -1.1%) is resurgent.
    • “Although we have a long list of things we’d like to talk to Google about, it’s actually a genuinely quite creative, positive environment,” Thompson says, noting the company is listening and taking action on things like a first-click-free policy on articles, allowing NYT to set more parameters for how people access its news.
    • Meanwhile: “Facebook we have found to be very difficult,” he says, noting a recent issue-ad policy that conflates news articles with political and advocacy ads. He notes a recent cake recipe that "may contain nuts" but no political content that went straight into Facebook's archive for political ads.
    • As for Twitter (TWTR -2.4%), it's "becoming an exciting and interesting platform again,” Thompson says.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 37 Comments
  • AAPL

    White House denies iPhone tariff exemption; Cook calls border separations "inhumane"

    • White House trade advisor Peter Navarro says he does not know of an Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) iPhone exemption in the U.S. trade talks with China.  
    • Navarro’s comment follows a The New York Times piece that said the Trump administration told CEO Tim Cook there wouldn’t be tariffs on iPhones assembled in China.  
    • Meanwhile, Tim Cook calls the administration’s separation of children from their parents at the border “inhumane” and “heartbreaking.”
    • Cook, to The Irish Times: “It’s heartbreaking to see the images and hear the sounds of the kids. Kids are the most vulnerable people in any society. I think that what’s happening is inhumane, it needs to stop.”  
    • Apple shares are down 1.6% to $185.66.    
    • Previously: iPhones, Intel chips exempt from tariffs? (June 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 287 Comments
  • GEVO

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/19/2018)

    • Gainers: GEVO +78%. MCF +7%. MPO +7%. PLM +6%. GSV +5%.
    • Losers: TELL -11%. SSRM -7%. CENX -7%. ZKIN -6%. ZEUS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix scratches $400 off its bucket list

    • Shares of Netflix (NFLX +2.7%) crossed over $400 for the first time ever within the last thirty minutes as this morning's bull rush of analyst notes buoyed sentiment again.
    • The new high mark for Netflix is $401.28.
    • Previously: Wall Street can't stop loving Netflix (June 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 76 Comments
  • SLDB

    Sarepta +37.5% as sell-side chimes in

    • "If you want to own something really transformative, buy this stock," says Baird bull Brian Skorney. "“If durable, this will transform the lives of DMD patients in the future."
    • Also a bull, RBC's Brain Abrahams sounds a modest note of caution. "While dramatic and far exceeding expectations, we acknowledge that there are still some outstanding questions, as the results are early and interim."
    • Chardan's Gbola Amusa says the news is a positive for Solid Biosciences (SLDB +55.7%), seeing “superior elements of the Solid microdystrophin construct."
    • "Transitioning to the next emerging large-cap," says JPMorgan, jacking its price target to $205.
    • HC Wainwright goes further, raising to $267.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • SRPT +37.5% to $144.69.
    • Previously: Sarepta set to pop on encouraging data on DMD gene therapy (June 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 6 Comments
  • WHR

    Disappointing read on U.S. appliances shipments

    • Whirlpool (WHR -2.5%) is down sharply after the Association of Home Appliance Manufacturers reports a 4.7% drop in major home appliances shipments during May and a 10.5% decline in the key AHAM 6 category.
    • Best Buy (BBY -1.1%), Home Depot (HD -1.1%) and Electrolux (OTCPK:ELUXF, OTCPK:ELUXY) also frequently see share prices movements after the monthly AHAM data is posted.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 13 Comments
  • T

    AT&T also pledges to cut off sales of user location data

    • AT&T (T +0.5%) is also joining in with a pledge to cut off selling its users' phone location data to outside brokers.
    • Verizon (VZ +2.1%) told Sen. Ron Wyden that it's ending such sharing after the discovery that at least one partner was sharing customer locations without permission. Wyden has asked all four major U.S. wireless providers for details on their privacy practices.
    • AT&T says it will stop sharing the data as soon as practical, with the hurdle being ensuring that services like emergency roadside service aren't affected.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 7 Comments
  • MEDFF

    Medreleaf Corp up 4.2% post Q4 results

    • Medreleaf Corp (OTCPK:MEDFF +4.2%) reports Q4 revenue growth of 15.9% Y/Y to C$12M, the growth was the result of increased production capacity, patient demand, yield improvements, and the continued growth of cannabis oil extracts for sale.
    • 1,425 adj. kilograms (+19% Y/Y) of cannabis products were sold at an average selling price of C$8.43 per adj. gram (-2.7% Y/Y).
    • Adj. EBITDA loss of C$4.7M, a decrease was due to increased overhead costs and investments in recreational brands, international business initiatives, and increased R&D efforts.
    • Adj. cash cost per gram sold of C$1.4 (-6% Y/Y), a decrease was due to increased production and yield improvements that resulted in improved efficiencies in labour utilization and allocation of fixed costs.
    • Adj. product contribution margin was C$8.5M (+14.9% Y/Y) & Adj. product contribution margin per gram sold of C$5.94 (-3.9% Y/Y).
    • The company introduced Equiposa, Orellium and Trutiva – three proprietary varieties of premium medical cannabis developed by MedReleaf's internal R&D program.
    • Also, entered into an exclusive licensing agreement with Woodstook Cannabis Company for the use of the iconic Woodstock brand in the Canadian cannabis market.
    • Signed an agreement to become the largest supplier to Cannamedical Pharma GmbH, a leading medical cannabis distributor in Germany with a network of over 1,800 pharmacies.
    • Cash and equivalents of C$215.9M and working capital of C$255.7M
    • Capex was C$40.9M primarily put towards production rooms, building improvements, furniture and other equipment related to the construction and development of the Bradford Facility.
    • Previously: Medreleaf Corp. reports Q4 results (June 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • VZ

    Deutsche Bank sees multiple upsides for Verizon

    • Verizon (VZ +2.2%) is seeing better fundamentals in wireless, Deutsche Bank says, with stabilizing pricing and the prospect that hot competition could ease a bit with disruptors Sprint and T-Mobile pushing forward with a potential merger.
    • Meanwhile, digital advertising is promising as well with headroom above, the bank says, with Oath holding only about 4% of a $100B market. And the company has upside from 5G ahead as well. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • DB's upgraded shares to Buy with a $56 price target, implying 15%-plus upside from current pricing.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 4 Comments
  • FBNK

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/19/2018)

    • Gainers: FBNK +19%. VCTR +6%. BSBR +6%. BBD +5%.
    • Losers: PAGS -13%. YRIV -11%. GRBK -10%. HGSH -9%. HCC -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • HP

    Helmerich & Payne upped to Buy at Jefferies, seeing Permian falloff shallow

    • Helmerich & Payne (HP +1.4%) is higher after Jefferies upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with an $80 price target, raised from $72, saying the 13% pullback over the past month is unwarranted.
    • Shares of land drillers are down 21% since mid-May as investors fret over potential Permian activity decline and the recent oil weakness, but Jefferies analyst Brad Handler believes any Permian drop-off will be shallow and limited to H2 of the year.
    • "HP retains best-in-class exposure to a super-spec rig market that should tighten further and allow for strong [free cash flow] inflection through the next 24 months," Handler writes, adding that U.S. land drilling fundamentals remain strong.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 4 Comments
  • SIMO

    Silicon Motion +3.3% as Needham sees 18% upside

    • Needham maintains a Buy rating on Silicon Motion (NASDAQ:SIMO) and raises its price target from $57 to $60.
    • New target represents a nearly 18% upside to yesterday’s close. 
    • Silicon Motion shares are up 3.3% to $52.70.  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • PSO

    Pearson -2.2% as Credit Suisse cuts to Underperform

    • Pearson (NYSE:PSO) is 2.2% lower after a cut to Underperform at Credit Suisse.
    • Shares just hit their 52-week high of $12.51 May 11, and the stock is about 9.6% below that point currently.
    • That's one of a small string of downgrades the stock has seen over the past several weeks; BNP Paribas cut its rating to Neutral from Outperform, and last week Barclays downgraded to Underweight from Equal Weight.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASTC

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/19/2018)

    • Gainers: ASTC +205%. GEVO +82%. SLDB +59%. SRPT +42%. NEPT +40%. CLBS +36%. FMI +28%. SPRO +28%. SRRK +22%. NURO +22%.
    • Losers: PTCT -20%. AXON -17%. ZKIN -15%. WVE -14%. GNPX -13%. PAGS -13%. YRIV -12%. AGMH -12%. XTLB -12%. VIVE -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • BUROF

    Burcon NutraScience slides 13% post FY results

    • Burcon NutraScience (OTCPK:BUROF -13%) reports FY revenue decrease of 37.5% Y/Y to C$0.05M.
    • 2018 revenues decreased, as prior year’s revenues included the recognition of C$0.04M in deferred revenues, whereas the nominal revenues reflect the company’s development phase status as it transitions to the commercial stage.
    • R&D expenses were C$1.9M (-13.6% Y/Y), the decrease is due to deferred development costs being fully amortized during 2017 & lower salaries expenses from the termination of an employee.
    • Intellectual property expenses of C$1.7M (+21.4% Y/Y), the increase is due mainly to higher maintenance fees for the soy and canola portfolios due the patent prosecution activities being temporarily suspended during 2017, in addition, the company incurred higher European registration fees this year from two soy patent applications that were granted in Europe.
    • G&A expenses C$2M (-13% Y/Y), the decrease is mostly attributed to decreases in SBC and non-cash financing expenses.
    • The company completed a rights offering that provided gross proceeds of C$3.5M, with net proceeds of C$3.4M.
    • Recently gained patent grants and allowances bring the company’s patent portfolio to 247 issued patents in various countries, including 65 in the U.S., as well as more than 270 active patent applications, including 41 additional U.S. patent applications.
    • Cash and equivalents of C$3.4M (-27.7% Y/Y), the management believes it has sufficient resources to fund its expected level of operations and working capital requirements to October 2018.
    • Previously: Burcon NutraScience Corp. reports FY results (June 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • TMUS

    T-Mobile, Sprint formally file with FCC for merger

    • As signaled, T-Mobile (TMUS +0.4%) has formally filed a Public Interest Statement with the FCC seeking a $26.5B merger with Sprint (S +0.1%).
    • In its filing, the company points to goals of building a world-class nationwide 5G network ("leapfrogging Verizon (VZ +2.5%) and AT&T (T +0.6%)"); allowing for "cord-cutting" on in-home broadband, and ensuring competitive gains ("up to a 55% decrease in price per GB and as much as a 120% increase in cellular data supply"); better rural service; and new choices for video and enterprise customers.
    • It's created a website where it is centralizing its case for the deal.
    • It's not an easy road ahead for the two challengers: The FCC will need to sign off on the merger, along with the Justice Dept.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 40 Comments
  • OMP

    Oasis Midstream signs third party deals, raises 2019 EBITDA outlook

    • Oasis Midstream Partners (OMP +3.5%) is sharply higher after signing third party agreements in the Williston Basin and raising its guidance for FY 2019 EBITDA.
    • OMP says the third party projects in combination with robust growth at Oasis Petroleum (OAS +1.3%) position it to extend its runway of 20% annualized distribution growth.
    • OMP reaffirms FY 2018 EBITDA guidance of $61-$65M while raising its FY 2019 EBITDA outlook including growth activities by 14% to $94-$97M and distribution coverage to 1.5x vs. 1.3x excluding the new agreements.
    • OMP also raises expectations for 2018 capex required to fulfill third party agreements to $285-$300M from $230-$270M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • ONCE

    Sarepta's good news sparks Spark, up 6%

    • Sarepta Therapeutics' DMD gene therapy-stoked rally, shares are currently up 38% on more than a 6x surge in volume, has spread to gene therapy developer Spark Therapeutics (ONCE +6.3%), albeit on below-average volume.
    • Spark's pipeline includes SPK-7001 for choroideremia, SPK-9001 for hemophilia B and SPK-8011 for hemophilia A.
    • Previously: Sarepta set to pop on encouraging data on DMD gene therapy (June 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • VZ

    Verizon ending location-sharing after leaks

    • After prompting from a U.S. senator, Verizon (VZ +2.5%) says it's ending a location-sharing program that resulted in at least one partner company sharing subscriber location without consent.
    • Verizon has shared the data with "location aggregators" LocationSmart and Zumigo, but says it's notified companies that "it intends to terminate their ability to access and use our customers’ location data as soon as possible."
    • The company was responding to Sen. Ron Wyden, who's asked the big four U.S. wireless carriers about privacy practices.
    • “We will not enter into new location aggregation arrangements unless and until we are comfortable that we can adequately protect our customers’ location data through technological advancements and/or other practices," Verizon tells Wyden.
    • Securus -- a prison telephone company unauthorized to get locations from Verizon -- began offering an expanded service letting sheriffs and corrections officers find a user's location without a court order, using data it got from a third party who had gotten it from LocationSmart.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • SMAR

    Smartsheet -9.9% with low volume, no catalyst

    • Smartsheet (NYSE:SMAR) shares drop 9.9% with low volume and no new catalyst.
    • Volume at about 574K compared to the 701.22K average. 
    • Smartsheet shares are up 18.8% in the past week, 65.5% in the past month, and 65% YTD since the IPO.       
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM pulls back from heights as Pivotal downgrades after run

  • FERGD

    More on Ferguson's Q3 results

    • Ferguson (OTCQX:FERGD +0.9%) reported Q3 revenue growth of 10.2% Y/Y to $5.08B and +7.1% Y/Y organic growth.
    • Revenues by Geography: US $4.11B (+11.5% Y/Y), UK $629M (-10.9% Y/Y) and Canada & Central Europe $342M (+8.9% Y/Y).
    • Trading profit was $356M up 16.3% Y/Y.
    • Q3 Gross margin improved by 40 bps to 29.3%.
    • Company completed sale of Stark Group on March 29, 2018 for ~$1.2B.
    • Company repurchased 1.9M shares for $147M during the quarter, in accordance with ongoing $650M share buyback program.
    • “The US continued to grow strongly with organic revenue growth of 10.6% in the quarter. Growth was broadly based across all US regions, supported by good market conditions. We also continued to manage gross margins effectively, making further progress. We generated good growth in Canada and in the UK we continued to focus on executing the restructuring plan. The fourth quarter has started well with organic revenue growth in line with the third quarter. Given the third quarter outturn, the Group is well positioned for a successful outcome for the year", commented John Martin, CEO.
    • Previously: Ferguson reports Q3 results (June 19)

  • SRPT

    Sarepta set to pop on encouraging data on DMD gene therapy

    • Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT) is poised for a stout up move on the heels of its presentation of preliminary data on its gene therapy candidate for Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) during today's R&D day.
    • Results from three young ambulatory DMD patients treated with the gene therapy showed significant dystrophin gene expression, measured by the percentage of micro-dystrophin-positive fibers in muscle biopsy samples, and an 87% plunge in blood creatinine kinase, a biomarker for muscle damage.
    • No safety signals were observed.
    • The company believes that it could have the gene therapy available to DMD patients in as soon as two years if all goes well.
    • Shares have yet to resume trading. Quotes resumed at 10:23 am ET.
    • DMD-related tickers: (SLDB +18.9%)(CATB +6.6%)(SMMT +2.4%)(CAPR -2.9%)(PFE +0.3%)(WVE -5.5%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 8 Comments

    Novus on go with mid-stage study of OP-02 in otitis media; shares up 10% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Novus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NVUS) is up 10% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that the FDA is on board with the start of a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing drug/device combo OP-02 for the treatment of otitis media.
    • OP-02, administered via a metered dose inhaler, is comprised of a surfactant called dipalmitoylphosphatidylcholine (DPPC) and a spreading agent called cholesteryl palmitate (CP) suspended in a propellant.     Prices plunge for copper, industrial metals as trade worries ratchet up

    • Commodity futures including iron ore, copper, zinc and aluminum all tumble, as the escalating trade conflict between the U.S. and China slams industrial metals directly affected by trade pacts as well as those hit by the risks of an economic slowdown.
    • In Comex futures trading, July copper recently was -1.8% at $3.0515/lb., while copper on the LME was -1.7% at $6,843/metric ton from an earlier $6,836.50, its lowest since June 1.
